text: Looking great! one tweak I'd suggest on the comparison between years (total flight passangers over time) is to use a color scheme that is more gradual. Perhaps using a single hue, and increase saturation over time. It would be more intuitive, as right now I feel I have to jump between legend and graph to remember what came first.
Looking forward to seeing the final post on the network/geo graph! Love that you made a gif also, that medium has become very sharable on the social networks :slightly_smiling_face:
Agreed about the gif! I have been wanting to start making those for a while now. Interesting in the last few frames how the number of unique flights between LA and NY starts to stand oit

Its nice! I did not know about ‘gif’  using R! Also, Is this highcharts library really popular in R? I have heard of highcharts in JavaScript - not in r :slightly_smiling_face: - I have seen people use ggplot in R  
I was interested to know how you created the html too - was it using R markdown and shiny?

So I'm teaching kids how to code for a summer camp this week in JavaScript and the class has split into an advanced group. Within the advanced most kids are doing web development in JavaScript but I have one kid hell bent in coding Python.
That one kid has finished his Python project I assigned him earlier this week.
I'm looking for possible project ideas but this kid likes to be very technical and hates to make anything user friendly let alone pretty designs.

thanks for the feedback everyone! <@U061A3E0G>: great idea about the color scheme, i'll add that in next. <@U1GGRN36X>: try out [highcharter package](<http://jkunst.com/highcharter/hchart.html>) `install.packages("highcharter")`. It takes some time to get a feel of the syntax coming from ggplot, but those tutorial examples help a lot. Yes, the html was a R markdown output - I just used knitr and pushed the html output to github pages. 
<@U061A3E0G>, <@U061A5N1G>, <@U1GGRN36X> :  i'll let you guys know when i post the code for making the gif animation. It's not entirely in R, but uses a system command to ImageMagick to convert a series of png's to an animated gif

attachments.title: Highcharter
attachments.text: highcharter and R wrapper for highcharts
